page.title: 20FARMING SAMPLE STUDIES
page.content: Cont. from page 19 heifer calves are sold at Otley Market to other dairy farmers and the rest are used as replacements for the farmer's herd.The older cows are sold to a Pontefract slaughterhouse.The cows are milked twice a day and the milk is collected by a tanker from the Milk Marketing Board.Most of the farmer's income comes from livestock. He employs one female full-time worker. All the machinery on the farm is owned by the farmer.He has three tractors,manure spreader,fertilizer spreader,loader,yard scraper,grass mower,hay turner,2 harrows,rotavator, plough,sprayer and 4 trailers.The farmer cuts his hay but the barley is combined and baled by a contractor. Michael White,Robert Cole and Mark Winwood.Age 12.
